contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|ostmark}} {{Audio|Ostmark.ogg|'''Ostmark'''}} is a German term meaning either '''Eastern march''' when applied to territories or '''Eastern Mark''' when applied to currencies. ''Ostmark'' may refer to: *the medieval [[March of Austria]] and its predecessors ''Bavarian eastern march'' and ''March of Pannonia'' in a post-19th century usage *the medieval [[Saxon Eastern March]] east of the Elbe River *the eastern regions of the Prussia acquired in the partitions of Poland, mainly the [[Province of Posen]] *[[Ostmark (Austria)]], Austria's name when it was part of Nazi Germany *Ostmark was a [[Nazi Party#Regional administration|Gau]] of the Nazi Party, composed of the Prussian province Posen-West Prussia and eastern parts of Brandenburg ''Ostmark'' may refer to the following historical '''currencies''': *[[East German mark]] or ''Mark of the German Democratic Republic'', the East German currency before 1990 *[[German ostmark]], short-lived currency used in eastern areas occupied by Germany in 1918 ==See also== *[[German Eastern Marches Society]] *[[Army Group Ostmark]] {{disambiguation}}
